_comment_2: In Windows, these policies are stored under HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Google\Chrome\3rdParty\Extensions\<extensionID>\policy
_comment_3: e.g. a REG_DWORD named 'DisableNotifications' with a value of 1 will result in the notifications being disabled.
_comment_5: Chrome extension ID is found in the chrome://extensions page.

DisableNotifications.title: Disable Notifications
DisableNotifications.description: If set to true, notifications will be disabled.

DisableContextMenu.title: Disable Context Menu
DisableContextMenu.description: If set to true, the context menu will be disabled.

HideContinueButtons.title: Hide Continue Buttons
HideContinueButtons.description: If set to true, the continue buttons will be hidden.

HideReportButton.title: Hide Report Button
HideReportButton.description: If set to true, the report button will be hidden.

LockProtectionOptions.title: Lock Protection Options
LockProtectionOptions.description: If set to true, the protection options will be locked.

DisableClearAllowedSites.title: Disable Clear Allowed Sites
DisableClearAllowedSites.description: If set to true, the clear allowed sites button will be disabled.

IgnoreFrameNavigation.title: Ignore Frame Navigation
IgnoreFrameNavigation.description: If set to true, frame navigation will be ignored.

CacheExpirationSeconds.title: Cache Expiration Seconds
CacheExpirationSeconds.description: If set, the cache expiry time will be set to this value in seconds.
